original: 七佛俱胝佛母心大准提陀羅尼
analyzed: 七佛俱胝佛母心大准提陀羅尼
translated: The Heart Dhāraṇī of the Mother of the Seven Buddhas and Koṭī Buddhas, the Great Jñāninī
Dharma
Translated by Śubhakarasiṃha of the Tang Dynasty, by Imperial Order
A Separate Practice in a Single Section🔽Namaḥ saptānāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ,🔽Tryadhvānugatebhyaḥ,🔽Tathāgatakṣetreṣu,

original: 􄖩那􄗰麼􄙺颯􆻤哆􈁀喃去聲􄙺三􄢦藐􇩀三􈎭勃􇧺佗􄑈俱􄓜胝􈁀喃去聲􄕗怛􇩊姪也二合􄕤他􇩂唵􄑼折􄙐戾􈇓主􄙐戾􄑽准􇧼提􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩訶總攝二十五部大曼荼羅尼印。
analyzed: 􄖩那􄗰麼􄙺颯􆻤哆􈁀喃去聲􄙺三􄢦藐􇩀三􈎭勃􇧺佗􄑈俱􄓜胝􈁀喃去聲􄕗怛􇩊姪也二合􄕤他􇩂唵􄑼折􄙐戾􈇓主􄙐戾􄑽准􇧼提􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩訶總攝二十五部大曼荼羅尼印。
translated: Oṃ jñāninī svāhā. This dhāraṇī and mudrā encompass the great maṇḍala of the twenty-five divisions.
With the ring fingers and little fingers of both hands,

original: 相叉於內。🔽二中指直竪相拄。
analyzed: 相叉於內。 二中指直竪相拄。
translated: Cross them inside.🔽The two middle fingers are extended and touch each other.
The two index fingers are bent,
Attached to the first joint of the two middle fingers.

original: 二母指捻左右手無名指中節。
analyzed: 二母指捻左右手無名指中節。
translated: The two thumbs pinch the middle joint of the ring fingers of the left and right hands.
If there is an invocation,
The two index fingers come and go.

original: 佛言此呪印能滅十惡五逆一切重罪。
analyzed: 佛言此呪印能滅十惡五逆一切重罪。
translated: The Buddha said this dhāraṇī and mudrā can eliminate the ten evil deeds, the five heinous crimes, and all grave offenses.
It accomplishes all pure dharmas.
One will quickly attain enlightenment.
If one is a layperson,
Even if one does not abstain from alcohol, meat, spouse, and children,
But relies on my Dharma, one will certainly achieve accomplishment.

original: 佛言若求成就先依壇法。
analyzed: 佛言若求成就先依壇法。
translated: The Buddha said, If one seeks accomplishment, one should first rely on the altar method.
It is not the same as the extensive offerings of various schools.
Dig the ground and apply fragrant mud to establish it.
Use a one-sided clean mirror that has never been used before.
In front of the Buddha image, on the night of the fifteenth day of the month,
Make offerings according to one's ability.
Burn agalloch incense and pure water.
First, one should calm the mind and think of nothing.
Then, form the mudra and recite the mantra.
Recite the mantra over the mirror one hundred and eight times.
Store the mirror in a pouch or box.
Always keep it with you.
Later, when wishing to recite, simply use this mirror.
Place it in front of one's face, form the mudra and recite the mantra.
Use the mirror as the altar and one will achieve accomplishment.

original: 佛言欲持此呪於十五日夜。
analyzed: 佛言欲持此呪於十五日夜。
translated: The Buddha said, If one wishes to uphold this mantra on the night of the fifteenth day,
Purely bathe and put on new clean clothes.
Facing the east, sitting in the half-lotus position.
Place a mirror in front.
According to the availability of incense, flowers, pure water, and other items.
First, one should still the mind and cut off thoughts.
Then, form the mudra and place it on the heart.
Recite this mantra one hundred and eight times.

original: 誦此呪時能使短命眾生還得增壽。
analyzed: 誦此呪時能使短命眾生還得增壽。
translated: When reciting this mantra, it can cause short-lived beings to regain extended life.
Even the disease of malaria can be cured,
let alone other illnesses.
If it does not cure, it is impossible.
The Buddha said, if a person single-mindedly contemplates in stillness,

original: 誦滿二十萬遍四十六十萬遍。
analyzed: 誦滿二十萬遍四十六十萬遍。
translated: and recites it twenty thousand times, forty-six hundred thousand times,
there is nothing in the world and beyond the world that will not be accomplished.
The Buddha said, if a layperson,
in the early morning, rinses the mouth with clean water,
before eating meat or blood.
Facing the east, facing the mirror, form the mudra.
Recite the mantra one hundred and eight times.
Do this without interruption for forty-nine days.
There will be auspicious events.

original: 准提菩薩令二聖者常隨其人。
analyzed: 准提菩薩令二聖者常隨其人。
translated: Bodhisattva Cundī will order two sages to always follow that person.

original: 心有所念皆於耳邊一一具說。
analyzed: 心有所念皆於耳邊一一具說。
translated: Whatever thoughts arise in the mind, they will all be fully explained in the ears.
The Buddha said that beings with a short lifespan and many illnesses,
on the night of the fifteenth day of the month,

original: 燒安悉香誦呪結印一百八遍。
analyzed: 燒安悉香誦呪結印一百八遍。
translated: should burn ankusha incense and recite the mantra while forming the mudra one hundred and eight times.
Demons, lost minds, wild foxes, and evil illnesses,
will all appear in the mirror in their original forms.
Kill or release as you wish, they will never come again.
Increase lifespan to immeasurable.
The Buddha said that if a person lacks the marks of merit and virtue,
and seeks office but is not promoted,
always recite this mantra in front of a mirror.
Merit and virtue and office will surely be accomplished.
The Buddha said that if a person wishes to do something,
they should first contemplate the holy one of the prajñā mantra,

original: 正念此呪具滿七遍端身。
analyzed: 正念此呪具滿七遍端身。
translated: and recite this mantra seven times in a row with a straight body.
After a short while, the body will naturally shake.
Then you will know that it can be accomplished and will bring good fortune.
If the body is rigid and moves forward or backward,
then you will know that it cannot be accomplished and there will surely be calamities.
The Buddha said that if you want to know whether this method will succeed or not,
Recite the mantra according to the method for a full seven days.

original: 便於夢中見佛菩薩及以華菓。
analyzed: 便於夢中見佛菩薩及以華菓。
translated: Then in a dream you will see the Buddha, Bodhisattvas, and flowers and fruits.
Spit out black things from the mouth and later eat white things.
Then you will know it is accomplished.

original: 佛言此陀羅尼有大勢力。
analyzed: 佛言此陀羅尼有大勢力。
translated: The Buddha said, This dharani has great power.
If you recite it with utmost sincerity, you will certainly realize it yourself.
It can cause a withered tree to blossom.
How much more so for worldly rewards!

original: 若常誦持水火刀兵怨家毒藥皆不能害。
analyzed: 若常誦持水火刀兵怨家毒藥皆不能害。
translated: If you always recite it, water, fire, weapons, enemies, and poison will not be able to harm you.
If you suddenly die from being injured by ghosts and spirits,
Form the mudra and recite the mantra seven times.
Use the mudra to seal the heart, and they will all return to life.
If the house is uneasy and ghosts and spirits cause misfortune,
Recite the mantra over four lumps of earth to suppress it and they will leave.
The Buddha said, If a person's six relatives are not harmonious,
And do not love and care for each other,
Recite the mantra according to the method and they will be reconciled.
Hearing the name and seeing the body, they will all give rise to joy.
Whatever is sought will be fulfilled.
How much more so if one can observe the precepts fully!
Single-mindedly purify and recite according to the Dharma.

original: 不轉此身即證菩提有大功力。
analyzed: 不轉此身即證菩提有大功力。
translated: Without changing this body, one will attain enlightenment and have great power.
The Buddha said, If a person wishes to live long,
In an ancient stupa or deep mountains,
Or in a clean room, rely on a mirror as the altar.
Fully complete two, four, sixty, and one hundred thousand recitations.
Mix blue lotus flowers with anxiously-awaited incense and burn it.
In sleep dreams, dream of eating immortal medicine.

original: 或授仙方或於鏡中有五色光。
analyzed: 或授仙方或於鏡中有五色光。
translated: Or be given an immortal prescription, or in the mirror there is five-colored light.
In the light there is medicine, take and eat as you wish.
You will then attain longevity.

original: 佛言若依法誦持一心精勤。
analyzed: 佛言若依法誦持一心精勤。
translated: The Buddha said, If you recite and uphold according to the Dharma, single-mindedly diligent,
The power and benefits cannot be fully described.
This mirror altar method must not be seen by others.
If seen, it is not good and will not be completed.

original: 須密之此法不可說自當證知。
analyzed: 須密之此法不可說自當證知。
translated: This method must be kept secret and cannot be spoken of. You will naturally realize and know it yourself.

original: 隨意所求速得成就受勝妙樂。
analyzed: 隨意所求速得成就受勝妙樂。
translated: According to your wishes, you will quickly attain accomplishment and receive supreme bliss.
One proof is complete.
